overview.title: About the planet weight calculator
overview.content: The Planetary Weight Calculator allows you to find out how much you would weigh on various solar system planets and the Moon. Weight depends on the force of gravity, which varies on each planet. For example, on Mars you will weigh much less than on Earth, but on Jupiter you will weigh much more!
overview.additionalContent: All calculations are based on accurate scientific data on the gravitational acceleration of each planet. The calculator takes into account real gravity coefficients expressed relative to Earth's gravity. Conversion between kilograms and pounds is supported for the convenience of users from different countries.

calculation.title: How is weight calculated on another planet?
calculation.content: Weight on another planet is calculated by multiplying your weight on Earth by that planet's gravity coefficient. Each planet has its own gravitational force, expressed as a percentage of Earth's.
calculation.formula: Weight on Planet = Weight on Earth × (Planet Gravity / Earth Gravity)
calculation.example: For example, if you weigh 70 kg on Earth, then on Mars (gravity 37.8%) you will weigh about 26.5 kg, and on Jupiter (gravity 236.4%) you will weigh about 165.5 kg.

faqItems.q: Why does weight differ on different planets?
faqItems.a: Weight depends on the gravitational force of the planet. For example, on Mars the weight is less than on Earth because Mars' gravity is only 37.8% of Earth's, while on Jupiter the weight is greater due to its powerful gravity (236.4% of Earth's).

faqItems.q: How to calculate weight on another planet?
faqItems.a: Weight on a planet is calculated using the formula: Weight on a planet = weight on Earth × (gravity of the planet / gravity of the Earth). Our calculator automatically performs this calculation for all planets.

faqItems.q: Why is Pluto included too?
faqItems.a: Although Pluto is removed from the list of planets and classified as a dwarf planet, it remains an interesting example with very low gravity (only 7.1% of Earth's), making it an important comparison.

faqItems.q: What planets are included in the calculator?
faqItems.a: The calculator includes all the planets of the solar system: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, as well as the Moon and Pluto for complete comparison.

faqItems.q: Why does mass remain constant, but weight changes?
faqItems.a: Mass is the amount of matter in a body and is independent of gravity. Weight is a force of attraction that depends on the gravity of the planet. Therefore, on different planets your weight will be different, although your mass will remain the same.

faqItems.q: On which planet will I weigh the least?
faqItems.a: You will weigh the least on Pluto (7.1% of Earth's weight), followed by the Moon (16.6%) and Mars (37.8%). On these celestial bodies, gravity is much weaker than Earth's.

faqItems.q: On which planet will I weigh the most?
faqItems.a: You will weigh the most on Jupiter (236.4% of Earth's weight), followed by Neptune (112.5%), Saturn (108.4%) and Uranus (88.9%). Jupiter has the most powerful gravity of all the planets.

faqItems.q: Are gravity coefficients accurate?
faqItems.a: Yes, all gravity coefficients are based on accurate scientific data from NASA and other space agencies. They are calculated based on the mass and radius of each planet according to the law of gravity.

faqItems.q: Can the calculator be used for scientific purposes?
faqItems.a: The calculator uses accurate scientific data and is suitable for educational purposes. However, for professional astronomical calculations, it is recommended to use more specialized tools.

faqItems.q: Why is the weight on Venus almost the same as on Earth?
faqItems.a: Venus has 90.7% of Earth's gravity because its mass is 81.5% of Earth's and its radius is approximately equal to Earth's. This makes Venus the closest planet in gravity to Earth.

faqItems.q: What weight will a person weighing 80 kg have on different planets?
faqItems.a: With a mass of 80 kg, the weight will be: Mercury - 30.16 kg, Venus - 72.56 kg, Mars - 30.24 kg, Jupiter - 189.12 kg, Saturn - 86.72 kg, Uranus - 71.12 kg, Neptune - 90 kg, Moon - 13.28 kg, Pluto - 5.68 kg.

faqItems.q: Why does Jupiter have so much weight?
faqItems.a: Jupiter is the largest planet in the solar system, with a mass 318 times that of Earth. Despite its large radius, its gravitational acceleration is 236.4% of Earth's.

faqItems.q: Can I use pounds instead of kilograms?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator supports both units of measurement: kilograms (kg) and pounds (lb). You can choose a unit of measurement that is convenient for you.

faqItems.q: Does altitude on the planet's surface affect weight?
faqItems.a: Theoretically yes, the higher you are, the weaker the gravity. However, for practical purposes, the calculator uses average values ​​of gravitational acceleration on the surface of planets.

faqItems.q: Why is the gravity on Saturn less than on Earth, although the planet is larger?
faqItems.a: Saturn is a gas giant with a very low density. Despite its enormous mass, due to its large radius, the gravity on its surface is only 108.4% of that on Earth.

faqItems.q: How is planetary gravity calculated?
faqItems.a: Gravity is calculated using Newton's formula: g = GM/r², where G is the gravitational constant, M is the mass of the planet, r is the radius of the planet. Coefficients are expressed relative to terrestrial gravity.

faqItems.q: Why do Mercury and Mars have similar weights?
faqItems.a: Despite their different sizes, both planets have similar gravity (Mercury - 37.7%, Mars - 37.8%) due to the ratio of their mass and radius. Mercury is smaller but denser, so the gravity is almost the same.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to calculate weight for children?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator works for any weight. Just enter the baby's weight on Earth and the calculator will show how much he would weigh on each planet.

faqItems.q: Why did astronauts jump so high on the moon?
faqItems.a: On the Moon, gravity is only 16.6% of Earth's, so the astronauts weighed 6 times less. This allowed them to jump much higher than on Earth.

faqItems.q: Will my weight change if I lose weight on Earth?
faqItems.a: Yes, if you lose weight on Earth, your weight will change proportionally on all planets. The calculation formula uses your current weight on Earth as a base value.

faqItems.q: Why is Uranus lighter than Earth?
faqItems.a: Although Uranus is larger than Earth in size, it has a lower density and lower gravity (88.9% of Earth's) due to its gas composition and large radius.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to calculate the weight on the moons of other planets?
faqItems.a: In the current version, the calculator includes only the main planets of the solar system and the Moon. Expansion for satellites of other planets is planned in future updates.

faqItems.q: Why is Neptune heavier than Earth?
faqItems.a: Neptune, despite its smaller size compared to Jupiter, has a higher density and gravity of 112.5% ​​of Earth's due to its composition and mass.

faqItems.q: How does gravity affect the health of astronauts?
faqItems.a: Prolonged exposure to low gravity conditions (such as on the Moon) can lead to bone loss and muscle atrophy. On planets with increased gravity (Jupiter), the load on the body would be critical.

faqItems.q: Why does Pluto have such weak gravity?
faqItems.a: Pluto is a dwarf planet with a very small mass (only 0.2% of the mass of Earth). Its gravity is only 7.1% that of Earth, making it one of the weakest places in the solar system.

faqItems.q: Can the calculator be used for animals?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator works for any weight, including animals. Just enter the weight of an animal on Earth and you will find out how much it would weigh on other planets.

faqItems.q: What is the gravity on the Sun?
faqItems.a: Gravity on the surface of the Sun is approximately 274 m/s² (28 times greater than Earth's). However, the calculator does not include the Sun, since the temperature on its surface makes it impossible to stay there.

faqItems.q: Why is it so hot on Mercury but gravity is weak?
faqItems.a: Temperature depends on the distance to the Sun, and gravity depends on the mass and radius of the planet. Mercury is close to the Sun (high temperature), but small and light (low gravity).

faqItems.q: Is it possible to save the calculation results?
faqItems.a: You can copy the calculation results or take a screenshot of the page. Some browsers also allow you to save the page as a PDF.

faqItems.q: Does the calculator work on mobile devices?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator is fully adapted to work on mobile devices, tablets and smartphones. The interface automatically adjusts to the screen size.

faqItems.q: Why might the results be slightly different from other calculators?
faqItems.a: Slight differences may occur due to different gravity data sources or rounding of values. Our calculator uses current NASA data.

faqItems.q: Can the calculator be used for educational purposes?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator is ideal for educational purposes, helping to understand the difference in gravity between planets and its effect on weight. It's great for school projects and astronomy lessons.

items.title: Moon - cosmic lightness
items.content: On the Moon you will weigh 6 times less than on Earth. This is why astronauts can jump so high on the lunar surface!

faqItems.a: Yes, you can use the calculator to compare compatibility with different people by simply entering different birth dates.

faqItems.q: Does time of birth count?
faqItems.a: No, the current algorithm only uses date of birth without taking into account time. This makes the calculator easier to use.

faqItems.a: Levels from 'Perfect Match' to 'Difficult Compatibility' show the percentage of compatibility and give a brief description of the relationship.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to save the results?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can copy the results and save them for personal use or share them with a partner.

faqItems.q: Which zodiac signs are most compatible?
faqItems.a: According to astrology, the most compatible signs of the same element are: fire (Aries, Leo, Sagittarius), earth (Taurus, Virgo, Capricorn), air (Gemini, Libra, Aquarius), water (Cancer, Scorpio, Pisces).

faqItems.q: Does age difference affect compatibility?
faqItems.a: Yes, the algorithm takes into account age differences. A small difference (1-5 years) usually adds points to compatibility, a large difference can reduce the percentage.

faqItems.q: What is numerology compatibility?
faqItems.a: Numerology studies the influence of numbers on human life. Numerological compatibility is calculated based on the sum of the birth date numbers and their meanings.

faqItems.q: Why can the same result differ?
faqItems.a: The algorithm includes an element of randomness for variety. This makes the calculator more interesting and entertaining, but does not mean scientific accuracy.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to calculate the compatibility of friends?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator can be used to calculate the compatibility of any two people, not just romantic couples. This works for friends, colleagues or family members too.

faqItems.q: How to interpret the compatibility percentage?
faqItems.a: 90-100% is an ideal match, 80-89% is excellent compatibility, 70-79% is good compatibility, 60-69% is average compatibility, 50-59% is satisfactory, less than 50% is difficult compatibility.

faqItems.q: Do names count towards the calculation?
faqItems.a: The current algorithm only uses dates of birth. Names can affect numerology compatibility, but are not taken into account in this calculator.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for a long-term relationship?
faqItems.a: The calculator is intended for entertainment purposes and cannot predict the success of long-term relationships. What is more important is real communication, mutual understanding and joint efforts in relationships.

faqItems.q: What is the minimum percentage that is considered good?
faqItems.a: A percentage above 70% is considered good compatibility, above 80% - excellent. However, remember that this is an entertainment tool and not a scientific forecast.

faqItems.q: Does birth season affect compatibility?
faqItems.a: Yes, the algorithm takes into account the season of birth (spring, summer, autumn, winter) as an additional compatibility factor.

faqItems.q: Why might the results be different when re-calculating?
faqItems.a: The algorithm includes an element of randomness to create a variety of results. This makes the calculator more interesting and entertaining.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to calculate compatibility for three or more people?
faqItems.a: The current calculator is designed for a couple of people. For three or more people, you can carry out several calculations in pairs and compare the results.

faqItems.q: How accurate are astrological calculations?
faqItems.a: Astrology is not a science, and its methods have no scientific basis. The calculator uses astrological principles for entertainment purposes and does not claim scientific accuracy.

faqItems.q: Does the time of day of birth affect the outcome?
faqItems.a: No, the current algorithm uses only the date of birth without taking into account the time of day. For a more accurate astrological chart, you need to know the exact time of birth.

faqItems.q: Can I share the results on social networks?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can copy the results and share them on social networks or instant messengers. This is a popular way to have fun with friends.

faqItems.q: How does numerology calculation work?
faqItems.a: Numerology sums the numbers of the date of birth until a single digit number is obtained (for example, 03/15/1990 = 1+5+0+3+1+9+9+0 = 28 → 2+8 = 10 → 1+0 = 1). The results of the two people are then compared.

faqItems.q: Why do some couples with the same sign have different compatibility?
faqItems.a: In addition to the zodiac sign, the algorithm takes into account numerology, age difference, birth season and other factors, so the results may differ even for the same sign.

faqItems.q: Can I use the calculator for business partnerships?
faqItems.a: Technically you can, but the results are for entertainment purposes and should not be used for serious business decisions. For business, practical factors are more important.

faqItems.q: What does 'Complex Compatibility' mean?
faqItems.a: This does not mean that a relationship is impossible. Difficult compatibility (less than 50%) simply indicates potential difficulties that can be overcome with mutual desire and work on the relationship.

faqItems.q: How often can I use the calculator?
faqItems.a: You can use the calculator an unlimited number of times. Try different combinations of birth dates to compare results.

faqItems.q: Does the calculator work on mobile devices?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator is fully adapted to work on mobile devices, tablets and smartphones. The interface automatically adjusts to the screen size.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to choose a child's name?
faqItems.a: The calculator uses birth dates, not names. To calculate the compatibility of a name with parents, you will need a separate numerology tool.

faqItems.q: Is the calculator free?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator is completely free and available without registration. You can use it an unlimited number of times.

faqItems.q: Are the calculation results saved?
faqItems.a: The results are not saved on the server. You can copy them manually or take a screenshot for personal use.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to calculate compatibility for an existing couple?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator can be used for any couple of people, regardless of whether they are in a relationship or just planning to meet.

faqItems.q: Does year of birth affect results?
faqItems.a: The year of birth influences through age differences and through numerological calculations. These factors are taken into account in the overall compatibility percentage.

faqItems.q: Why does the calculator show different results for the same pair?
faqItems.a: The algorithm includes an element of randomness for variety. This is a feature of the entertainment calculator, and not an error in the calculations.

items.content: The most popular passwords include '123456', 'password' and 'qwerty' - they are easy to crack.

items.content: A password of 8 characters can be cracked in a few hours, and a password of 12 characters can be cracked in thousands of years.

items.content: Entropy measures the randomness of a password. The higher the entropy, the more difficult it is to crack the password.

faqItems.q: Are passwords stored?
faqItems.a: No, everything happens locally in the browser. Passwords are not transmitted to the server and are not saved.

faqItems.q: How long should the password be?
faqItems.a: It is recommended to use passwords of at least 12 characters for maximum security.

faqItems.q: What symbols are best to use?
faqItems.a: Use a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters for maximum security.

faqItems.q: What is password entropy?
faqItems.a: Entropy measures the randomness of a password. The higher the entropy, the more difficult it is to crack the password.

faqItems.q: Can I use generated passwords for bank accounts?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generated passwords are suitable for any accounts, including bank accounts, provided that all security rules are followed.

faqItems.q: What do the 'exclude similar characters' options mean?
faqItems.a: This option excludes characters that are easy to mix up (such as 0 and O, 1 and l), making the password more readable.

faqItems.q: Is it safe to use a password generator?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator works entirely locally in your browser and does not transfer data to the server.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to customize the password length?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can select the password length from 4 to 128 characters using the slider.

faqItems.q: What to do if you forgot the generated password?
faqItems.a: Unfortunately, generated passwords are not saved. It is recommended to use a password manager for storage.

faqItems.q: Is it suitable for mobile devices?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is fully adapted to work on smartphones and tablets.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to create a password using only numbers?
faqItems.a: Technically it is possible, but passwords made only of numbers are very weak. It is recommended to use a combination of different types of symbols.

faqItems.q: What are 'ambiguous characters'?
faqItems.a: These are characters that can be interpreted ambiguously (for example, {, }, [, ]). Their exclusion makes the password more readable and universal.

faqItems.q: Why are long passwords more secure?
faqItems.a: With each additional symbol, the number of possible combinations increases exponentially. A 16-character password has trillions of times more combinations than an 8-character password.

faqItems.q: Can I use a password more than once?
faqItems.a: No, we recommend using a unique password for each account. Reusing your password reduces the security of all accounts.

faqItems.q: How often should you change your passwords?
faqItems.a: Current recommendations: change passwords only if you suspect a leak. Unnecessarily changing regularly does not improve safety.

faqItems.q: What does 'entropy bit' mean?
faqItems.a: The entropy bit indicates the degree of randomness of the password. The larger the bits, the more possible combinations and the more difficult it is to crack the password.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to create a memorable password?
faqItems.a: The generator creates completely random passwords. For memorable passwords, it is recommended to use a password manager to store them.

faqItems.q: Is the generator suitable for corporate use?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator can be used for corporate purposes, but it is recommended to check compliance with your company's security policies.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to copy the password automatically?
faqItems.a: Yes, use the 'Copy' button to automatically copy the password to the clipboard.

faqItems.q: Why are some passwords shown as 'weak'?
faqItems.a: Weak passwords are usually short, use only one type of character, or have low entropy. Add length and character variety.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to create a password without characters?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can disable the symbols option and create a password using only letters and numbers. However, symbols significantly increase reliability.

faqItems.q: Does the generator work offline?
faqItems.a: After the page loads, the generation is performed locally in the browser, so the generator can work even with a slow Internet connection.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for Wi-Fi passwords?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is suitable for creating Wi-Fi passwords. Choose a sufficient length (at least 12 characters) and include all character types.

faqItems.q: What to do if the site does not accept some characters?
faqItems.a: Use the 'Exclude ambiguous characters' option or create a password without symbols, using only letters and numbers.

faqItems.q: Can I use one password for multiple devices?
faqItems.a: Not recommended. Each device and service must have a unique password for maximum security.

faqItems.q: How to check the strength of your password?
faqItems.a: The generator automatically shows the reliability level (weak, fair, good, reliable) and the entropy bit when generating.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to create PIN codes?
faqItems.a: PIN codes typically use only numbers. The generator can create a password using only numbers, but for PIN codes 4-6 digits are usually enough.

faqItems.q: Does the choice of character types affect the generation speed?
faqItems.a: No, generation occurs instantly regardless of the selected options. All calculations are performed locally in the browser.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for cybersecurity training?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is great for teaching cybersecurity basics and demonstrating the importance of creating strong passwords.

faqItems.q: What does 'possible combinations' mean?
faqItems.a: This is the number of different passwords that can be created with the given parameters. The more combinations there are, the more difficult it is to find a password using brute force.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to create tokens?
faqItems.a: Technically possible, but tokens usually require specific formats. The generator is more suitable for user passwords.

faqItems.q: Why is it recommended to use a password manager?
faqItems.a: A password manager securely stores all passwords, automatically fills out forms, and helps you create unique passwords for each account.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to generate passwords for commands?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can generate multiple passwords and share them with your team, but make sure everyone uses a unique password for their account.

faqItems.q: Does password length affect usability?
faqItems.a: Yes, very long passwords (more than 20 characters) can be difficult to enter. A balance between security (12-16 characters) and convenience is recommended.

faqItems.q: Can I use the Key API to create passwords?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is suitable for generating API keys and access tokens, provided that the specific API requirements are met.

faqItems.q: What to do if the generated password is not accepted by the site?
faqItems.a: Check the site's password requirements. You may need to exclude certain characters or change the length.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to recover a password?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is ideal for creating new passwords when recovering or changing existing ones.

faqItems.q: How to ensure maximum password security?
faqItems.a: Use 16+ characters in length, include all character types (uppercase, lowercase, numbers, symbols), use a unique password for each account, and store in a secure password manager.

faqItems.q: Does the generator work in browser private mode?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator works in any browser mode, including private. All generations occur locally and are not saved.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to create master passwords?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is great for creating password manager master passwords. Use 20+ characters in length and all character types.

faqItems.q: Does the number of characters in a set affect reliability?
faqItems.a: Yes, the more different characters available (uppercase, lowercase, numbers, symbols), the higher the entropy and strength of the password for the same length.

items.title: History of dice

items.title: Mathematics of cubes

items.title: Platonic solids

faqItems.q: Is it possible to select multiple dice?
faqItems.a: Yes, select the number of dice before rolling. You can roll from 1 to 10 dice at a time.

faqItems.q: What types of dice are available?
faqItems.a: There are 7 types available: D4 (tetrahedron, 1-4), D6 (cube, 1-6), D8 (octahedron, 1-8), D10 (decahedron, 1-10), D12 (dodecahedron, 1-12), D20 (icosahedron, 1-20) and D100 (percentage, 1-100).

faqItems.q: Is it possible to save the results?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can copy the results to the clipboard or download the throw history in a text file.

faqItems.q: How random are the results?
faqItems.a: The simulator uses cryptographically strong JavaScript algorithms to generate truly random results. Each throw is independent and equally probable.

faqItems.q: Is it suitable for board games?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is ideal for D&D, Pathfinder, Warhammer and other board and role-playing games. Supports all standard dice types.

faqItems.q: Can it be used on mobile devices?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is fully adapted to work on smartphones and tablets. The interface is optimized for touch control.

faqItems.q: How many throws are saved in history?
faqItems.a: History saves the last 10 throws. You can clear your history at any time, download it as a text file, or copy the results.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to customize the animation?
faqItems.a: Animation is built into the simulator and cannot be disabled for a better user experience. The animation lasts about 300 milliseconds for visual feedback.

faqItems.q: Is it free to use?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is completely free and does not require registration. Use it as many times as you need without restrictions.

faqItems.q: Does it work without the Internet?
faqItems.a: Yes, after the first download the simulator works completely offline. All calculations are performed locally in the browser.

faqItems.q: What do D4, D6, D20 and other designations mean?
faqItems.a: The letter D stands for 'dice' and the number stands for the number of faces. For example, D6 is a six-sided die with numbers from 1 to 6, D20 is a twenty-sided die from 1 to 20.

faqItems.q: Can you roll the dice to make a decision?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is great for random selection from several options. Use D6 to select from 6 options or D20 for a wider range.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the average of several throws?
faqItems.a: The simulator automatically calculates the sum and average of all rolls. Average = sum of all values ​​/ number of cubes.

faqItems.q: Is it suitable for teaching probability?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is ideal for learning probability theory, statistics and cube mathematics. You can conduct experiments and analyze the results.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to generate random numbers?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator can generate random numbers within a given range. Select the appropriate die type (for example, D100 for numbers 1 to 100).

faqItems.q: What type of cube is used most often?
faqItems.a: The most popular type is D6 (6-sided die), which is used in most classic board games. D20 is popular in role-playing games.

faqItems.q: Can the dice be rolled simultaneously or one at a time?
faqItems.a: All selected dice are rolled simultaneously. Each die receives an independent random value.

faqItems.q: How do shot statistics work?
faqItems.a: The simulator shows the sum of all dropped values, the arithmetic average and the history of the last 10 throws. This helps analyze the distribution of results.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for testing algorithms?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is suitable for testing algorithms that require random data. You can generate random numbers repeatedly for experimentation.

faqItems.q: What are Platonic solids in the context of cubes?
faqItems.a: D4, D6, D8, D12 and D20 are based on the five Platonic solids from geometry: tetrahedron, hexahedron, octahedron, dodecahedron and icosahedron respectively.

faqItems.q: How does the D100 percentage cube work?
faqItems.a: The D100 generates a random number from 1 to 100, which is ideal for percentage calculations, probabilities and wide range random events.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to customize the die range?
faqItems.a: No, the range of values ​​is fixed for each die type. D6 always gives values ​​from 1 to 6, D20 - from 1 to 20, and so on.

faqItems.q: How to copy the results of a throw?
faqItems.a: After the roll, click the 'Copy' button next to the results. The text with the results will be copied to the clipboard in the format: 'Roll result: 3, 5, 2 = 10'.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to export throw history?
faqItems.a: Yes, use the 'Download' button in the history section. The history will be saved in a text file with all the details of the throws.

faqItems.q: How to clear throw history?
faqItems.a: Click the 'Clear' button in the history section. This will delete all saved throws and you will start with a clean history.

faqItems.q: Why is the sum of opposite faces on D6 always 7?
faqItems.a: This is a mathematical property of a standard six-sided die: opposite sides always add up to 7 (1+6, 2+5, 3+4) for balance when rolling.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to play poker with dice?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is great for dice poker (Yahtzee). Roll 5 D6 dice and create combinations: pair, three of a kind, four of a kind, full house and others.

faqItems.q: What algorithm is used to generate random numbers?
faqItems.a: Uses JavaScript's built-in random number generator (Math.random()), which provides a cryptographically secure pseudo-random distribution.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to roll the dice to select a random name from a list?
faqItems.a: Yes, if you have 6 names, use D6, if you have 20 names, use D20. The die result will indicate the number of the item in your list.

faqItems.q: How does the average work when rolling multiple dice?
faqItems.a: The average value is calculated as the sum of all values ​​divided by the number of cubes. For example, when rolling two D6s with results of 3 and 5, the average = (3+5)/2 = 4.

faqItems.q: Is it suitable for games like Monopoly?
faqItems.a: Yes, for Monopoly use 2 D6 dice. The simulator will show the result of each dice and their sum, which is necessary to move around the playing field.

tips.title: Tips for use
tips.content: Use the simulator for decision making, entertainment, or probability education. Please remember that this is an entertainment tool and not a scientific method of decision making.

howTo.title: How to flip a coin online
howTo.description: Step-by-step instructions for using the coin toss simulator

step1.name: Select coin style
step1.text: Choose from three styles: classic, gold or emoji.

step3.name: View the result
step3.text: The result is displayed with animation. You will see heads or tails.

step4.name: Check the statistics
step4.text: Statistics show the total number of throws, the number of heads and tails.

step5.name: Use history
step5.text: View the history of all throws and copy the results if necessary.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to customize the coin?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can choose from three design styles: classic (standard coin), gold (stylized gold coin), or emoji (visual representation using emoji icons).

faqItems.q: Are the results really random?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator uses a cryptographically strong JavaScript random number generator (Math.random()), which ensures an equally likely result for each throw (50% heads, 50% tails).

faqItems.q: Is it possible to toss several times in a row?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can flip a coin an unlimited number of times. Each throw is independent of the previous ones and has an equal probability of landing heads or tails.

faqItems.q: Are the statistics saved?
faqItems.a: Statistics are saved in the current browser session and show the total number of throws, the number of heads and tails. Statistics are reset when the page is refreshed or the browser is closed.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to copy the results?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can copy the roll results to the clipboard using the 'Copy' button. The copied text includes the result (heads or tails), coin style, and roll statistics.

faqItems.q: Is there animation?
faqItems.a: Yes, there is a realistic coin toss animation of approximately 300 milliseconds for visual feedback and improved user experience.

faqItems.q: Is it suitable for decision making?
faqItems.a: It is an entertaining tool designed to help you make simple everyday decisions. Not recommended for important life or financial decisions.

faqItems.q: Can it be used on mobile devices?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is fully adapted to work on smartphones and tablets. The interface is optimized for touch control and various screen sizes.

faqItems.q: Is it free to use?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is completely free and does not require registration. Use it as many times as you need without restrictions and without the need to create an account.

faqItems.q: How do statistics work?
faqItems.a: Statistics automatically tracks each flip and shows: the total number of flips (flipCount), the number of heads (headsCount) and the number of tails (tailsCount). Statistics are updated after each new throw.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to reset statistics?
faqItems.a: Yes, use the button 'Strete' for pridi stories of rows and statistics. This is certainly meters to zero and succeeds all saved results.

faqItems.q: Is the throw history saved?
faqItems.a: The history of all throws is saved in the current browser session. You can view the sequence of all results, but the history is not saved between sessions or page reloads.

faqItems.q: What is the probability of getting heads or tails?
faqItems.a: The probability of getting heads is equal to the probability of getting tails and is 50% (0.5) for each throw. This is a classic example of equally probable events in probability theory.

faqItems.q: Is it suitable for teaching probability theory?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is ideal for demonstrating the concepts of probability, equiprobable events and the law of large numbers. You can experiment with multiple rolls to study the statistics.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for games?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator can be used for board games where you need to randomly choose between two options, or for games with children where you need to determine who goes first.

faqItems.q: Does it work without the Internet?
faqItems.a: Yes, after the first download the simulator works completely offline. All calculations are performed locally in the browser and no internet connection is required to generate random results.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to resolve disputes?
faqItems.a: The simulator can be used to amicably resolve minor disputes or to choose between equally valid options, but is not recommended for serious conflicts or important decisions.

faqItems.q: What algorithm is used to generate random numbers?
faqItems.a: Uses JavaScript's built-in pseudo-random number generator (Math.random()), which provides a cryptographically strong distribution and enough randomness for entertainment purposes.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to change the probability of getting heads or tails?
faqItems.a: No, the simulator is specifically configured to produce equally probable outcomes (50/50) for heads and tails, which corresponds to a real physical coin toss. The probability setting is not available.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to generate random numbers?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator can be used as a binary random number generator (0 or 1, heads or tails) for various purposes: decision making, training, testing algorithms.

faqItems.q: Is there a limit on the number of throws?
faqItems.a: No, you can flip a coin an unlimited number of times. The only limitation is the amount of browser memory for storing the history of throws in the current session.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for drawing lots?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is great for tossing up between two options. For example, to determine the team that starts the game, or to choose between two equivalent options.

faqItems.q: How does the toss animation work?
faqItems.a: The animation is a visual effect of the coin spinning, which lasts about 300 milliseconds. This creates a realistic feeling of flipping a physical coin before displaying the result.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to export the results?
faqItems.a: Currently, results can be copied to the clipboard, but direct export to a file is not available. You can manually save the copied text to a file for later use.

faqItems.q: Is it suitable for studying statistics?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is ideal for learning the basics of statistics: frequency of events, probability, distribution of results, the law of large numbers. You can experiment with different numbers of throws.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to make a decision between multiple options?
faqItems.a: To choose between two options - yes. For three or more options, it is recommended to use a random number generator or dice calculator (D4, D6, D8, etc.) from our entertainment section.

faqItems.q: What's the difference between coin styles?
faqItems.a: The only difference is in the visual presentation. Classic coin - standard design, gold - stylized gold coin, Emoji - icons instead of the image of the coin. The probability of results is the same for all styles.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for testing algorithms?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator can be used to test algorithms that require binary random inputs. Each roll represents an independent random event.

faqItems.q: Is it suitable for business decision making?
faqItems.a: No, the simulator is intended only for entertainment and making simple everyday decisions. For business decisions, it is recommended to use professional analysis tools and specialist consultations.

faqItems.q: Can probabilities be used to teach children?
faqItems.a: Yes, the simulator is great for teaching children the basics of probability theory in a playful way. Kids can experiment with shots and watch the stats get closer to 50/50 with more shots.

faqItems.q: How often can you flip a coin?
faqItems.a: You can flip a coin as often as you like without restrictions. The simulator works instantly and is ready to use as soon as the page loads.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to randomly select a name?
faqItems.a: To choose between two names - yes. For more options, we recommend using the random number generator or dice calculator from our entertainment section.

overview.title: Online definition of zodiac sign
overview.content: Our zodiac sign calculator will help you determine your astrological sign by date of birth. Find out more about yourself and your characteristics through astrology!
overview.additionalContent: The calculator determines one of 12 zodiac signs based on the exact date of birth: Aries (March 21 - April 19), Taurus (April 20 - May 20), Gemini (May 21 - June 20), Cancer (June 21 - July 22), Leo (July 23 - August 22), Virgo (August 23 - September 22), Libra (September 23 - October 22), Scorpio (October 23 - November 21), Sagittarius (November 22 - December 21), Capricorn (December 22 - January 19), Aquarius (January 20 - February 18), Pisces (February 19 - March 20). For each sign, the calculator shows the element (Fire, Earth, Air, Water), quality (Cardinal, Fixed, Mutable) and a brief description of the character. The results can be copied for future use.

howTo.title: How to determine your zodiac sign online
howTo.description: Step-by-step instructions for using the zodiac sign calculator

step4.name: Use the results

faqItems.q: Why can a date refer to two signs?
faqItems.a: The boundaries between signs sometimes change due to leap years and time zones. The calculator uses standard astrological dates, but exact boundaries may vary slightly between different astrological systems.

faqItems.q: Is your zodiac sign determined accurately?
faqItems.a: The calculator uses standard astrological dates to determine your zodiac sign. Accuracy depends on the correctness of the entered date of birth and compliance with the astrological system used.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to find out the compatibility of signs?
faqItems.a: This calculator only determines the zodiac sign by date of birth. To calculate compatibility between signs, use a special compatibility calculator from the entertainment section.

faqItems.q: What do elements and qualities mean?
faqItems.a: Elements (Fire, Earth, Air, Water) and qualities (Cardinal, Fixed, Mutable) are the astrological characteristics of the signs. The elements determine the main character traits, and the qualities determine the way the energy of the sign is expressed.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to copy the results?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can copy information about the zodiac sign (sign, symbol, period, element, quality, description) to the clipboard using the 'Copy' button for further use or saving.

faqItems.q: Is it free to use?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator is completely free and does not require registration. Use it as many times as you like without restrictions to determine zodiac signs by birth dates.

faqItems.q: Does it work on mobile devices?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator is fully adapted to work on smartphones and tablets. The interface is optimized for touch control and various screen sizes.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for children?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator is suitable for determining the zodiac sign of children. Just enter your child's date of birth, and the calculator will determine his zodiac sign, element and quality.

faqItems.q: Is the information saved?
faqItems.a: No, the information is not saved or transferred to third parties. All data is processed locally in the browser and the results are not sent to the server.

faqItems.q: Is Astrology Scientifically Based?
faqItems.a: Astrology is an entertainment practice with no scientific basis. The calculator is intended for entertainment and learning astrological concepts, not for making important life decisions.

faqItems.q: What signs belong to the fire element?
faqItems.a: The fire element includes three signs: Aries (March 21 - April 19), Leo (July 23 - August 22) and Sagittarius (November 22 - December 21). Fire signs are characterized by energy, passion and leadership qualities.

faqItems.q: What signs belong to the earth element?
faqItems.a: The earth element includes three signs: Taurus (April 20 - May 20), Virgo (August 23 - September 22) and Capricorn (December 22 - January 19). Earth signs are practical, reliable and materially oriented.

faqItems.q: What signs relate to the air element?
faqItems.a: The air element includes three signs: Gemini (May 21 - June 20), Libra (September 23 - October 22) and Aquarius (January 20 - February 18). Air signs are sociable, intellectual and love communication.

faqItems.q: What signs belong to the water element?
faqItems.a: The water element includes three signs: Cancer (June 21 - July 22), Scorpio (October 23 - November 21) and Pisces (February 19 - March 20). Water signs are emotional, intuitive and sensitive.

faqItems.q: What are cardinal signs?
faqItems.a: Cardinal signs (Aries, Cancer, Libra, Capricorn) are proactive signs that start new projects and strive for change. They are active, ambitious and ready to take responsibility.

faqItems.q: What are fixed signs?
faqItems.a: Fixed signs (Taurus, Leo, Scorpio, Aquarius) are stable signs that finish what they start. They are persistent, determined and have a strong will.

faqItems.q: What are mutable signs?
faqItems.a: Mutable signs (Gemini, Virgo, Sagittarius, Pisces) are flexible signs that easily adapt to change. They are multifaceted, sociable and able to see different sides of a situation.

faqItems.q: How many zodiac signs are there?
faqItems.a: There are 12 zodiac signs: Aries, Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius and Pisces. Each sign corresponds to a certain period of the year.

faqItems.q: How is the sign determined for a date located on a boundary?
faqItems.a: The calculator uses standard astrological date ranges. If the date is on the border between two signs, the calculator will determine the sign based on the exact dates of each sign. In some cases, it may be necessary to clarify the time of birth for a more accurate determination.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to determine the zodiac sign for a future date?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator can determine the zodiac sign for any date, including future ones. However, traditionally, the zodiac sign is determined by a person's date of birth, rather than by an arbitrary date.

faqItems.q: What should I do if I am not sure of my exact date of birth?
faqItems.a: Enter your known date of birth. The calculator will determine the sign based on the entered date. If you only know the month, you can try different dates in that month to determine possible signs.

faqItems.q: Does the time of birth affect the zodiac sign?
faqItems.a: In traditional tropical astrology, the zodiac sign is determined by the position of the Sun at the time of birth, which depends on the exact time and place of birth. The calculator uses a simplified method based on date of birth only, which is suitable for entertainment purposes.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to determine another person's sign?
faqItems.a: Yes, just enter the date of birth of the person you are interested in, and the calculator will determine his zodiac sign, element, quality and provide a brief description of his character.

faqItems.q: How does tropical astrology differ from sidereal astrology?
faqItems.a: Tropical astrology (used in Western astrology) is based on the position of the Sun relative to the equinoxes. Sidereal astrology is based on the fixed stars. The calculator uses the tropical system.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to determine the rising sign (Ascendant)?
faqItems.a: No, this calculator only determines the Sun sign (sun sign) by date of birth. To determine the Ascendant, Moon and other planetary positions, a complete natal chart with the exact time and place of birth is required.

faqItems.q: What is the most common zodiac sign?
faqItems.a: The distribution of zodiac signs among the population is approximately even, since each sign covers approximately the same period (about 30 days). Small differences may be due to seasonal fluctuations in fertility.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to create a horoscope?
faqItems.a: The calculator determines only the zodiac sign by date of birth. To create a complete horoscope, additional information (time and place of birth) and special astrological programs are required.

faqItems.q: What do the symbols of the zodiac signs mean (♈, ♉, ♊, etc.)?
faqItems.a: These are astrological symbols (glyphs) that are traditionally used to represent each zodiac sign. Each symbol has a historical and astrological meaning associated with mythology and astronomy.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to determine the zodiac sign for dates in the past?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator can determine the zodiac sign for any date, including historical dates. Zodiac signs are determined by the solar calendar and remain constant.

faqItems.q: Does time zone affect the definition of a sign?
faqItems.a: The calculator uses a simplified method for determining the sign only by date of birth, without taking into account time and time zone. For an accurate determination, taking into account the time of birth, a professional astrological calculation is required.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to determine the sign for a leap year?
faqItems.a: Yes, the calculator correctly handles leap year dates (February 29). The zodiac sign is determined by the date on the calendar, regardless of whether it is a leap year or not.

faqItems.q: Which signs are considered the most compatible?
faqItems.a: In astrology, it is believed that signs of the same element are often compatible with each other (for example, fire signs with fire signs). Also, signs of opposite elements are often compatible in certain combinations. For a detailed compatibility analysis, use a special compatibility calculator.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to reset the results?
faqItems.a: Yes, use the 'Reset' button to clear the entered date and results. This will allow you to determine the zodiac sign for the new date of birth.

faqItems.q: Are results saved between sessions?
faqItems.a: No, results are not saved between sessions. When you refresh the page or close the browser, the data is deleted. You can copy the results for saving.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for group identification of signs?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can enter different birth dates sequentially and determine the zodiac signs for several people. Just enter a date, get the result, copy it, then reset and enter a new date.

faqItems.a: The algorithm uses databases of popular and rare names for different categories, combining them taking into account selected parameters (type, gender, length). The generator randomly selects names from matching databases and returns the requested number of unique options.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get real names?

faqItems.q: Does the generator select names for brands?

faqItems.q: Is it possible to customize the naming style?
faqItems.a: Yes, select the name type (baby, character, project, book/game, fantasy/Sci-Fi), gender (male, female, any), length (short, medium, long) and number (1 to 10) to get suitable options.

faqItems.q: How many names can you generate?

faqItems.q: Does the generator work on mobile phones?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is fully adapted for mobile devices and tablets. The interface is optimized for touch control and various screen sizes.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to copy the results?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can copy individual names or the entire list of names to the clipboard using the 'Copy All' button. You can also download the results in a text file.

faqItems.q: Is it free to use?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is completely free and does not require registration. Use it as many times as you like without restrictions and without the need to create an account.

faqItems.q: Are generated names saved?
faqItems.a: No, names are not saved on the server, everything happens locally in the browser. The results are not sent to the server and are not saved between sessions. You can copy or download names to save.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for commercial projects?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generated names can be freely used for any purpose, including commercial projects, brands, literary works and games. There are no restrictions on use.

faqItems.q: What types of names are available?
faqItems.a: There are 5 types of names available: Baby name (real popular names), Character name (for stories and games), Project name (for brands and startups), Book/game name (creative options), Fantasy/Sci-Fi name (for fictional worlds).

faqItems.q: How to choose name length?
faqItems.a: Choose from three options: Short (usually 3-5 characters), Medium (6-9 characters) or Long (10+ characters). The length influences the selection of names from the corresponding databases.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to generate names in different languages?
faqItems.a: The generator works with name databases that may include names from different cultures and languages. For precise language selection, it is recommended to use the appropriate name type and settings.

faqItems.q: Are names appropriate for fantasy works?
faqItems.a: Yes, specifically for fantasy works there is a 'Fantasy/Sci-Fi name' type that generates names with mythological, epic and futuristic elements suitable for fictional worlds.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get the same names?
faqItems.a: The generator tries to select unique names from the database, but with a large number of requests, duplicate options may appear. It is recommended to use different parameters to obtain varied results.

faqItems.q: How to download generated names?
faqItems.a: Use the 'Download' button to save all generated names to a text file. The file will contain a list of names, one per line.

faqItems.q: Does the generator work without the Internet?
faqItems.a: Yes, after the first download the generator works completely offline. All name databases are loaded locally into the browser, and no Internet connection is required for generation.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to reset the results?
faqItems.a: Yes, use the 'Reset' button to clear all parameters and generated names. This will allow you to start a new generation with different settings.

faqItems.q: Are the names suitable for international projects?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator generates names that can be used for international projects. The 'Project Name' mode is especially suitable for creating brand names with global potential.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get names for video games?
faqItems.a: Yes, use the 'Book/Game Name' or 'Fantasy/Sci-Fi Name' type to generate character names in video games. Customize the gender, length and quantity to get suitable options.

faqItems.q: How often can names be generated?
faqItems.a: You can generate names as often as you like without restrictions. The generator works instantly and is ready to use as soon as the page loads.

faqItems.q: Are names appropriate for literary works?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is ideal for creating character names in literary works. Use the 'Character Name' or 'Book/Game Name' type with gender and length settings to get suitable options.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to create names on social networks?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generated names can be used as nicknames or usernames on social networks. The 'Character' mode is especially suitable for creating original names.

faqItems.q: Does gender choice affect the outcome?
faqItems.a: Yes, the choice of gender affects the type of names selected from the corresponding databases. 'Male' selects male names, 'Female' selects feminine names, 'Any' selects names of both genders or universal options.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get names for board games?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is great for creating character names in board games. Use the 'Fantasy/Sci-Fi name' type for fantasy games or 'Character name' for realistic ones.

faqItems.q: How to choose the best name from the generated ones?
faqItems.a: Generate several sets of names with different parameters, compare options, consider the context of use (child, character, brand) and choose the name that best suits your goals and preferences.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get rare and unusual names?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator includes both popular and rare names in its databases. Experiment with different types, lengths and parameters to get more original options.

faqItems.q: Are the names suitable for comic books?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is suitable for creating comic book character names. Use the 'Character' type for realistic comics or the 'Fantasy/Sci-Fi name' type for superhero and sci-fi comics.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to create names for pets?
faqItems.a: Technically yes, but the generator is optimized for names of people and projects. For pet names, you can use the 'Character' mode with appropriate parameters, although the results may not be entirely suitable.

faqItems.q: Are settings saved between generations?
faqItems.a: Settings are saved in the current browser session, but are not saved between page reloads. You can change the parameters before each new generation.

faqItems.q: Can names be exported to other formats?
faqItems.a: Currently, names can be copied to the clipboard or downloaded as a text file. Direct export to other formats (CSV, JSON) is not available, but you can use a text file for further processing.

faqItems.q: Are names suitable for creating avatars?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generated names can be used as avatar names in games and virtual worlds. The 'Character' or 'Fantasy/Sci-Fi Name' modes are especially suitable for this.

overview.title: Online character generator
overview.content: Our character generator will help you create unique heroes with a full set of characteristics: character, strengths and weaknesses, profession and history. Ideal for writers, screenwriters and game designers.
overview.additionalContent: The generator supports 3 types of characters: realistic (for modern works and realistic games), fantasy (for fantasy literature and RPG games) and Sci-Fi (for science fiction and futuristic games). There are 4 age groups available for each type: child, teenager, adult and elderly. The generator creates a complete character profile: a unique name corresponding to the character's age, type and gender, age, character description, 3-5 strengths, 2-4 weaknesses, profession (appropriate for age and type) and a brief background story. You can generate from 1 to 5 characters at the same time. All descriptions can be copied to the clipboard or downloaded as a text file for future use.

calculation.title: How does a generator work?
calculation.content: The algorithm creates a holistic portrait of the character, taking into account the selected type, gender, age and genre. Generates realistic or fantastic characteristics depending on the settings.

items.title: Character development
items.content: Well-developed characters make stories more interesting and memorable.

items.title: Character psychology
items.content: Character strengths and weaknesses create conflict and drive the plot forward.

items.title: Creative process
items.content: Creating characters is a creative process that requires inspiration and an understanding of human nature.

faqItems.q: Can the generator be used for a book or game?
faqItems.a: Yes, all results can be freely used for personal and commercial projects. The generator is ideal for creating characters for literary works, video games, board games, comics and other creative projects.

faqItems.q: Does the generator create only appearance or character as well?
faqItems.a: The generator creates a complete psychological portrait of the character: a unique name, age, description of character and personality, 3-5 strengths, 2-4 weaknesses, profession (appropriate for age and type) and a brief background. Appearance is not generated.

faqItems.q: Is there generation by language?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator takes into account the selected interface language and creates names and descriptions of characters in the appropriate language. Russian, English, Spanish and German languages ​​are supported.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to customize the character type?
faqItems.a: Yes, choose one of three types: Realistic (for contemporary works), Fantasy (for fantasy literature and RPG games) or Sci-Fi (for science fiction). Each type has its own database of names, characters, professions and stories.

faqItems.q: How many characters can you generate?
faqItems.a: You can generate from 1 to 5 characters at a time. You can repeat the generation as many times as you like to get more options until you find the right characters for your project.

faqItems.q: Does the generator work on mobile phones?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is fully adapted for mobile devices and tablets. The interface is optimized for touch control and various screen sizes.

faqItems.q: Can descriptions be copied?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can copy character descriptions to the clipboard using the 'Copy Description' button for each character, or copy all descriptions at once. You can also download all the characters in a text file.

faqItems.q: Is it free to use?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is completely free and does not require registration. Use it as many times as you like without restrictions and without the need to create an account.

faqItems.q: Are generated characters saved?
faqItems.a: No, characters are not saved on the server, everything happens locally in the browser. The results are not sent to the server and are not saved between sessions. You can copy or download descriptions for saving.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for commercial projects?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generated characters can be freely used for any purpose, including commercial projects, publications, games and other commercial uses. There are no restrictions on use.

faqItems.q: What age groups are available?
faqItems.a: There are 4 age groups available: Child (5-12 years), Teen (13-17 years), Adult (25-55 years) and Senior (60+ years). Corresponding professions and characteristics are available for each group.

faqItems.q: How does the choice of gender affect the character?
faqItems.a: The choice of gender affects the choice of name from the corresponding databases (male, female, or generic names) and may affect some character characteristics. You can also select 'Any' for universal options.

faqItems.q: How many strengths and weaknesses does each character have?
faqItems.a: Each character gets 3-5 strengths and 2-4 weaknesses, randomly selected from the corresponding databases depending on the character type (realistic, fantasy or Sci-Fi).

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get a character without weaknesses?
faqItems.a: No, the generator always creates characters with strengths and weaknesses to create more realistic and interesting characters. Weaknesses bring characters to life and create opportunities for story development.

faqItems.q: Are the characters suitable for video games?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is ideal for creating characters for video games. Use 'Fantasy' for RPG and fantasy games, 'Sci-Fi' for sci-fi games, or 'Realistic' for modern and realistic games.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for board games?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is great for creating characters for tabletop RPGs like D&D, Pathfinder and others. Use the 'Fantasy' type for fantasy campaigns or the 'Sci-Fi' type for sci-fi games.

faqItems.q: Are the characters suitable for literary works?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is ideal for creating characters for stories, novels and other literary works. Generate characters with suitable characteristics and adapt them to your plot.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get a comic book character?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is suitable for creating comic book characters. Use the 'Realistic' type for realistic comics or the 'Fantasy'/'Sci-Fi' type for superhero and sci-fi comics.

faqItems.q: Does the generator work without the Internet?
faqItems.a: Yes, after the first download the generator works completely offline. All character databases are loaded locally into the browser, and no Internet connection is required for generation.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to reset the results?
faqItems.a: Yes, use the 'Reset' button to clear all parameters and generated characters. This will allow you to start a new generation with different settings.

faqItems.q: How to download generated characters?
faqItems.a: Use the 'Download' button to save all generated characters to a text file. The file will contain full descriptions of all characters, one per character.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get a character with a specific profession?
faqItems.a: The profession is selected randomly from the database of professions corresponding to the character type and age group. You cannot select a specific profession, but you can repeat the generation until you obtain the desired profession.

faqItems.q: Are the characters suitable for the script?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is suitable for creating characters for movie scripts, TV series and other visual works. The generated characteristics will help in developing characters for scenarios.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to create NPCs in games?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is great for creating NPCs (non-player characters) in games. Generate multiple characters to fill the game world with a variety of inhabitants with unique characteristics.

faqItems.q: How often can characters be generated?
faqItems.a: You can generate characters at any frequency without restrictions. The generator works instantly and is ready to use as soon as the page loads.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get the same characters?
faqItems.a: The generator tries to create unique characters, but with a large number of requests, similar options may appear. It is recommended to use different parameters to obtain varied results.

faqItems.q: Are the characters suitable for animation?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is suitable for creating characters for animation projects. Character characteristics and stories can be used as the basis for animated characters.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to create personas for social media?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generated personas can be used as a basis for creating characters for social networks, blogs or online projects. Tailor the features to suit your style.

faqItems.q: Does age affect a character's characteristics?
faqItems.a: Yes, age affects the profession (children's classes are available for children, and corresponding professions for older people), some characteristics and the character's background.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get a character for children's literature?
faqItems.a: Yes, use the 'Child' or 'Teen' age group with the 'Realistic' type to create characters for children's literature. The generator will create suitable characteristics and stories.

faqItems.q: Are settings saved between generations?
faqItems.a: Settings are saved in the current browser session, but are not saved between page reloads. You can change the parameters before each new generation.

faqItems.q: Can characters be exported to other formats?
faqItems.a: Currently, characters can be copied to the clipboard or downloaded as a text file. Direct export to other formats (JSON, CSV) is not available, but you can use a text file for further processing.

seo.description: Free online fictional world generator for writers and games. Create a unique world with name, climate, culture, government, resources and conflicts. 4 types of worlds (fantasy, Sci-Fi, steampunk, post-apocalypse), generation from 1 to 3 worlds at a time, copying and downloading descriptions.

overview.title: Online generator of fictional worlds
overview.content: Our world generator will help you create unique fictional universes with a full range of characteristics: climate, culture, government, resources and conflicts. Ideal for writers, screenwriters and game designers.
overview.additionalContent: The generator supports 4 types of worlds: Fantasy (for epic fantasy works and RPG games), Sci-Fi (for science fiction and space operas), Steampunk (for Victorian steampunk and alternative history) and Post-Apocalypse (for post-apocalyptic works and survival). For each type, the generator creates a complete description of the world: a unique name, climate and nature (detailed description of the environment), culture and society (social structure and customs), ruler/power (form of government and leadership), resources and magic/technology (available resources and features), main conflict (main problems and tensions) and interesting fact or legend (mythology of the world). You can generate from 1 to 3 worlds at the same time. All descriptions can be copied to the clipboard or downloaded as a text file for future use.

calculation.title: How does a generator work?
calculation.content: The algorithm creates a complete world, taking into account the selected type and genre. Generates realistic or fantastic characteristics depending on the settings.

items.title: Creating Worlds
items.content: Well-developed worlds make stories more interesting and memorable.

items.title: Peacebuilding
items.content: Details of the world create conflicts and develop the plot.

items.title: Creative process
items.content: Creating worlds is a creative process that requires inspiration and an understanding of the genre.

faqItems.q: Can the generator be used for a book or game?
faqItems.a: Yes, all results can be freely used for personal and commercial projects. The generator is ideal for creating worlds for literary works, video games, board games, comics and other creative projects.

faqItems.q: Does the generator create only a description or also details?
faqItems.a: The generator creates a complete detailed description of the world: unique name, climate and nature (detailed description of the environment and geography), culture and society (social structure, customs and traditions), ruler/power (form of government and management system), resources and magic/technology (available resources and unique features), main conflict (main problems, tensions and challenges) and interesting fact or legend (mythology and history of the world).

faqItems.q: Is there generation by genre?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator supports 4 different genres: Fantasy (for epic fantasy and RPG games), Sci-Fi (for science fiction and space opera), Steampunk (for Victorian steampunk and alternative history) and Post-Apocalypse (for post-apocalyptic works). Each genre has its own unique database of climates, cultures, governments, resources and conflicts.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to customize the world type?
faqItems.a: Yes, choose one of four types: Fantasy (magic and mythical creatures), Sci-Fi (technology and space), Steampunk (steam and mechanisms) or Post-Apocalypse (survival and destruction). Each type has its own unique characteristics and elements.

faqItems.q: How many worlds can you generate?
faqItems.a: You can generate from 1 to 3 worlds at a time. You can repeat the generation as many times as you like to obtain additional options until you find suitable worlds for your project.

faqItems.q: Does the generator work on mobile phones?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is fully adapted for mobile devices and tablets. The interface is optimized for touch control and various screen sizes.

faqItems.q: Can descriptions be copied?
faqItems.a: Yes, you can copy world descriptions to the clipboard using the 'Copy Description' button for each world, or copy all descriptions at once. You can also download all worlds in a text file.

faqItems.q: Is it free to use?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is completely free and does not require registration. Use it as many times as you like without restrictions and without the need to create an account.

faqItems.q: Are generated worlds saved?
faqItems.a: No, worlds are not saved on the server, everything happens locally in the browser. The results are not sent to the server and are not saved between sessions. You can copy or download descriptions for saving.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for commercial projects?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generated worlds can be freely used for any purpose, including commercial projects, publications, games and other commercial uses. There are no restrictions on use.

faqItems.q: What elements does the description of the world include?
faqItems.a: The description of a world includes 7 main elements: name (the unique name of the world), climate and nature (geography and environment), culture and society (social structure and customs), ruler/authority (government system), resources and magic/technology (available resources and features), main conflict (main problems) and interesting fact or legend (mythology).

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get a world with a specific climate?
faqItems.a: The climate is selected randomly from the climate database corresponding to the world type. You cannot select a specific climate, but you can repeat the generation until the desired climate is obtained. Each type of world has its own unique climate variations.

faqItems.q: Are the worlds suitable for video games?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is ideal for creating worlds for video games. Use the 'Fantasy' type for RPG and fantasy games, 'Sci-Fi' for sci-fi games, or 'Post-Apocalypse' for survival games.

faqItems.q: Can it be used for board games?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is great for creating worlds for tabletop RPGs like D&D, Pathfinder and others. Use the 'Fantasy' type for fantasy campaigns or the 'Sci-Fi' type for sci-fi games.

faqItems.q: Are the worlds suitable for literary works?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is ideal for creating worlds for stories, novels and other literary works. Generate worlds with suitable characteristics and adapt them to your plot.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get a world for comics?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is suitable for creating worlds for comics. Use 'Fantasy' for superhero and sci-fi comics or 'Sci-Fi' for space comics.

faqItems.q: Does the generator work without the Internet?
faqItems.a: Yes, after the first download the generator works completely offline. All world databases are loaded locally into the browser, and no Internet connection is required for generation.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to reset the results?
faqItems.a: Yes, use the 'Reset' button to clear all parameters and generated worlds. This will allow you to start a new generation with different settings.

faqItems.q: How to download generated worlds?
faqItems.a: Use the 'Download' button to save all generated worlds to a text file. The file will contain complete descriptions of all worlds, one per world.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get a world with a specific culture?
faqItems.a: The culture is selected randomly from the culture database corresponding to the world type. You cannot select a specific crop, but you can repeat the generation until you obtain the desired crop. Each world type has its own unique cultural variants.

faqItems.q: Are the worlds suitable for scenarios?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is suitable for creating worlds for film scripts, TV series and other visual works. The generated characteristics will help in developing worlds for scenarios.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to create multiverses?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is great for creating multiple worlds for multiverses. Generate multiple worlds with different types and genres to create complex, multi-dimensional settings.

faqItems.q: How often can worlds be generated?
faqItems.a: You can generate worlds at any frequency without restrictions. The generator works instantly and is ready to use as soon as the page loads.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get identical worlds?
faqItems.a: The generator tries to create unique worlds, but with a large number of requests, similar options may appear. It is recommended to use different types to obtain varied results.

faqItems.q: Are the worlds suitable for animation?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is suitable for creating worlds for animation projects. Characteristics and descriptions of worlds can be used as the basis for animated settings.

faqItems.q: Can it be used to create worlds for social networks?
faqItems.a: Yes, generated worlds can be used as a basis for creating worlds for social networks, blogs or online projects. Tailor the features to suit your style.

faqItems.q: Does choosing a type affect all elements of the world?
faqItems.a: Yes, the choice of type affects all elements of the world: name, climate, culture, government, resources, conflicts and legends. Each type has its own unique databases for each element.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to get a world for children's literature?
faqItems.a: Yes, use the 'Fantasy' type to create fantasy worlds for children's literature. The generator will create suitable characteristics and elements that can be adapted for a child audience.

faqItems.q: Are settings saved between generations?
faqItems.a: Settings are saved in the current browser session, but are not saved between page reloads. You can change the parameters before each new generation.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to export worlds to other formats?
faqItems.a: Currently, worlds can be copied to the clipboard or downloaded as a text file. Direct export to other formats (JSON, CSV) is not available, but you can use a text file for further processing.

faqItems.q: Are worlds suitable for creating game mods?
faqItems.a: Yes, the generator is suitable for creating worlds for game mods. Use the generated descriptions as a basis for creating unique game worlds and settings.
